privacy_protocol:
Dear users of CASHBOX Wallet APP: We have updated the User Privacy Policy of CASHBOX Wallet APP. This version of the User Privacy Policy of CASHBOX Wallet APP will explain, on a case-by-case basis, the purpose, scope and manner in which each feature may collect personal information; how we protect your personal information.

Update time: June 2, 2020


[Special Notes]


Please read the User Privacy Policy of CASHBOX Wallet APP (especially the bold underlined content) carefully to learn more about how we collect, use and save information, and be sure to understand our rules on how to handle your personal information, so that you can make an appropriate choice about our services. The relevant terms in this Privacy Policy will be expressed as concisely as possible so that you can better understand them. By using or continuing to use our products and/or services after we update this Privacy Policy (we will promptly inform you of the updates), you agree to the content of this Privacy Policy (including the updated version) and agree that we will collect, use, save and share your relevant information in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

If you have any questions during the reading, feel free to email us at: CASHBOX@scry.info. You should stop using the CASHBOX Wallet APP immediately if you do not agree with any of the terms in the policy.


Introduction

CASHBOX Wallet App values user information security and privacy protection, and does its utmost to prevent your information from being leaked, damaged, or lost through reasonable and effective information security technology and management processes; provides you with convenient information management options to enhance your convenience of information management; protects your communication secrets, and protects your information and communication security. CASHBOX Wallet APP strictly complies with laws and regulations, only collects necessary information, and improves the transparency of information processing. In every link of product or service development, it integrates law, product, design and other factors with the concept of privacy protection to provide you with more secure and reliable services.

We formulate and follow the User Privacy Policy of CASHBOX Wallet APP (hereinafter referred to as "the Policy"), which mainly explains the following to you:

• What information do we collect;

• What do we use the information for;

• How do we share, transfer, and publicly disclose your personal information;

• How do we save your personal information;

• How do you manage personal information;

• Protection of minors' personal information

• Notification and revision

• How to contact us

I. Definition and Scope of Personal Information

Unless otherwise agreed, the terms used in the Policy have the following definitions.

1.1 Personal information: refers to all kinds of information recorded by electronic or other means that can identify the personal identity of a natural person individually or in combination with other information. The personal information involved in the Policy includes the name, nickname, date of birth, nationality, ID number, gender, age, personal biometric information, address, telephone number, company, institution, occupation of a natural person.

1.2 Personal sensitive information: refers to personal information that, once leaked, illegally provided or abused, may endanger the safety of person and property, and easily lead to damage to personal reputation, physical and mental health or discriminatory treatment. For example, personal sensitive information includes ID number, personal biometric information, bank account number, communication content, health and physiological information, etc. Therefore, you should exercise your own discretion to determine the authenticity, legality and validity of the relevant digital assets and/or information, and bear the liabilities and losses arising therefrom.

1.3 Anonymized information refers to information that is subject to technical processing of personal information so that the subject of personal information cannot be identified and cannot be recovered after processing, which is not included in personal information.

1.4 Other information that cannot be used to identify a specific natural person or reflect the activities of a specific natural person is not personal information.

Except the above definitions, other terms used in the Policy have the same meaning as those used in the User Service Agreement of CASHBOX Wallet APP. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions.


II. Information We Collect

2.1 CASHBOX Wallet is a digital asset wallet based on blockchain, including other auxiliary tools developed to facilitate the use of the blockchain system. The personal information collected by CASHBOX Wallet APP includes:

2.1.1 When you use or access the software, the software automatically receives and records the server values on the user's browser, including your device model, geographical location, IP address and other data, as well as the webpage records you request to access;

2.1.2 The data collected by the software about your transactions on the platform, including the wallet address, transfer-in and transfer-out records you created and imported;

2.1.3 Other personal information collected by the software will be clearly stated in a way to remind you and obtain your consent.

2.2 We may obtain the information generated or shared when you use third-party partner services. This includes that: we will obtain your login name and time for the services from a third party partner, or login time to CASHBOX Wallet for your authorization management when you use the CASHBOX Wallet account to log into the third-party partner service, or you use the service account of the third-party partner to log into the CASHBOX Wallet. Please read the user agreement or privacy policy of the third-party partner service carefully.


III. How do we use the information we collect

We strictly abide by the provisions of laws and regulations and the agreement with users, and use the collected information for the following purposes. If we use your information beyond the following purposes, we will explain it to you again and obtain your consent.

3.1 To provide you with services.

3.2 To satisfy your individual needs, such as language settings, location settings, personalized help services.

3.3 Product development and service optimization. For example, when our system fails, we will record and analyze the information generated when the system fails and optimize our services.

3.4 Safety guarantee. For example, we will use your information for identity verification, security precautions, anti-fraud monitoring, archiving or backup, customer security services and other purposes. The security software you download or install may detect malicious programs or viruses, or identify fraudulent information for you.

3.5 To evaluate and improve the effectiveness of our advertising and other promotional activities.

3.6 To manage software, such as software certification and upgrading, etc.

3.7 To invite you to participate in a survey about our services.

In order to provide you with a better experience, improve our services or use them for other purposes you agree, we may use the information collected through certain services for our other services, subject to applicable laws and regulations. For example, the information generated when you use one of our services will be used in another service to show you personalized content or advertisements, and used for user research, analysis and statistics, etc. To secure the service and help us better understand how our application is performing, we may record relevant information, such as application usage frequency, failure information, overall usage, performance data, and source of the application. We do not combine the information we store in the analysis software with the personally identifiable information you provide in your application.


IV. How Do We Share, Transfer, and Publicly Disclose Your Information

4.1 We will comply with relevant laws and regulations and keep your personal information confidential. We will not share your personal information with others unless:

A. Only by sharing your personal information can we provide the services you need.

B. We may share your relevant information within our affiliates in order to improve the quality of our products and services or to provide you with new products and services.

C. When you use any third-party service through the CASHBOX Wallet software, the CASHBOX Wallet will share your personal information with the third party providing the service as specified in the "Collection of Personal Information" clause.

D. When assisting in the settlement of disputes or controversies involving you, we may provide the necessary information to the third party who has an interest with you, so as to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of users.

E. Necessary personal information obtained by a criminal investigation organ in order to investigate a crime by law, or necessary personal information obtained by an administrative organ or judicial organ in a manner prescribed by law and with your authorization.

F. We provide information necessary to protect the public interest, property or safety, to the extent required or permitted by law.

G. Your express consent or authorization is required separately.

4.2 We will not provide your personal information for any third party organization or individual without legal procedures or your consent. We will sign strict confidentiality agreements with companies, organizations and individuals with whom we share personal information, and require them to process personal information in accordance with our instructions, the Privacy Policy and any other related confidentiality and security measures.

4.3 We will comply with relevant laws and regulations and keep your personal information confidential. We will not publicly disclose your personal information unless we have your prior express consent or authorization or are required by law.

4.4 In addition, according to applicable laws, regulations and national standards, we may share, transfer, and publicly disclose personal information in the following circumstances without prior authorization of the personal information subject:

A. Those directly related to national security and national defense security;

B. Those directly related to public safety, public health and major public interests;

C. Those directly related to criminal investigation, prosecution, trial and execution of judgments;

D. Those out of protecting the lives, properties, important legal rights and interests of personal information subjects or other individuals which however, is difficult to obtain the consent of users;

E. Personal information which is disclosed to the public by the subjects;

F. If the personal information is collected from legally disclosed information, such as legal news reports and government information disclosure.

4.5 In the event of any acquisition, merger, reorganization or other changes, we will require the changed entity to comply with the Privacy Policy and fulfill its original responsibilities and obligations. If the changed entity needs to change the purposes of using personal information, we will require the entity to obtain your express consent in advance. Internally, in the aforementioned acquisition and merger activities, the data managed by the acquired and merged objects (including user data) will be processed and protected using the same standards and requirements as the CASHBOX Wallet data.

V. How Do We Protect Your Personal Information

We provide appropriate safety guarantee for your information to prevent the loss, misuse, unauthorized access or disclosure of information.

5.1 We strictly abide by laws and regulations to protect communication secrets of users.

5.2 We will take a variety of security measures within a reasonable level of security to guarantee the security of information. For example, we use encryption techniques (e.g., TLS, SSL), anonymization, and other means to protect your personal information.

5.3 We set up specialized management systems, processes and organizations to ensure information security. For example, we strictly limit the number of people who access information and require them to perform confidentiality obligations and conduct reviews.

5.4 In case of personal information leakage or other security incidents, we will initiate contingency plans to prevent the expansion of security incidents and notify you in the form of push notifications, announcements, etc.

5.5 We will take all reasonable and feasible measures to ensure that irrelevant personal information is not collected. We will retain your personal information only for as long as it is necessary to achieve the purposes stated in the Privacy Policy, unless the retention period is extended or such retention is permitted by law.

5.6 The Internet is not an absolutely secure environment, and it is not possible to determine whether communication methods with other users such as e-mail, instant messaging, social software, etc. are fully encrypted. We recommend that you use complex passwords when using such tools, and pay attention to protecting the security of your personal information.

5.7 The Internet environment is not 100% secure, and we will do our best to ensure or guarantee the security of any information you send to us. If our physical, technical, administrative or protective facilities are damaged, resulting in unauthorized access to information, public disclosure, manipulation, or destruction, as well as damage to your legitimate rights and interests, we will assume corresponding legal responsibility.


VI. How Do We Save Your Personal Information

6.1 We implement appropriate physical, electronic, administrative and technical measures to protect and safeguard your personal data. We endeavour to ensure that any personal data collected through our platform is free from interference from third parties not related to us. The security measures we take include but are not limited to:

6.1.1 Physical measures: the records containing your personal data will be stored in a locked place.

6.1.2 Electronic measures: computer data containing your personal data will be stored on computer systems and storage media subject to strict log-in restrictions.

6.1.3 Management measures: we have set up relevant departments for the security protection of user information, established relevant internal control systems, and adopted strict authorization principles for staff who may have access to your information. Only our authorized staff will have access to your personal data and these staff will be subject to our internal code of conduct on the confidentiality of personal data. In addition, we constantly provide staff with trainings of relevant laws, regulations and privacy safety to strengthen their awareness of safety, and regularly organize internal relevant personnel to conduct emergency response trainings and emergency drills, so that they can master the post responsibilities and emergency response strategies and procedures

6.1.4 Technical measures: encryption technology such as Secure Socket Layer Encryption may be used to transfer your personal data.

6.1.5 Security measures: to ensure the security of your information, we are committed to using a variety of current and general security technologies and supporting management systems to minimize the risks of information disclosure, damage, misuse, unauthorized access, unauthorized disclosure, and change. For example, the network security layer software (SSL) is used for transmission encryption, information encryption and storage, thus severely restricting access to the data center. When transmitting and storing personal sensitive information (including personal biometric information), we will adopt security measures such as encryption, permission control, de-identification and desensitization.

6.1.6 Other measures: we will regularly review our procedures for the collection, storage and processing of personal data; restrict the access of our employees and suppliers to your data according to the necessary principles; and require our employees and suppliers to comply with strict contractual confidentiality obligations.

6.2 If you are aware of any security vulnerabilities on our platform, please contact us immediately so that we can take appropriate action as soon as possible.

6.3 Despite the implementation of the above technical and security measures, we cannot guarantee the absolute security of data transmission on the Internet, so we cannot absolutely guarantee that the personal information you provide to us through our platform will be secure at all times. We will update and publicize the security risk, assessment report on security impact of personal information and other relevant contents from time to time, which can be obtained through the announcement on this platform.

VII. How Do You Manage Your Information

7.1 Create A Wallet

You must first create a wallet on the platform before using this software services. Individual users who create wallets shall be natural persons who have reached the age of 18 or have full civil rights and capacity for civil conduct in accordance with the laws of the country where they are located, and can independently assume civil liabilities; legal persons, organizations or other institutions that intend to create a wallet shall designate a representative office of a natural person who has reached the age of 18 or has full civil rights and capacity for civil conduct in accordance with the laws of the country where they are located, and can independently assume civil liabilities.

7.2 Set wallet password, private key, mnemonic or Keystore

Adhering to the decentralized features of blockchain and for the purpose of protecting the security of users' digital tokens, this software provides decentralized services different from those provided by banking financial institutions. Therefore, you need to remember the wallet password (i.e. the password set by the user when creating/importing the wallet), private key, mnemonics or Keystore by yourself. We cannot provide you with the services such as retrieving the wallet password, private key, mnemonics or Keystore of users, freezing, reporting loss and recovering the wallet, or rolling back the transaction.

7.3 Inquire, correct and delete your information

You have the right to inquire, correct or supplement your information. If any of your personal data is inaccurate, you can request to update your information.

You may request us to delete your personal information in the following circumstances:

A. If our processing of personal information violates laws and regulations;

B. If we collect and use your personal information without your express consent;

C. If our processing of personal information seriously violates the agreement with you;

D. If you no longer use our products or services, or you take the initiative to log out of the account;

E. If we no longer provide you with products or services forever.

If we decide to respond to your request for deletion, we will also notify the subjects who have obtained your personal information from us as far as possible, and request them to delete your information in time (unless otherwise provided by laws and regulations, or these subjects have independently obtained your authorization).

After you delete the relevant information on your own or with our assistance, we may not be able to immediately delete the corresponding information from the backup system due to applicable laws and security technologies, and we will securely store your personal information and isolate it from any further processing until the backup can be cleared or anonymized.

7.4 Keep Your Information Safe

You must keep your mobile device containing CASHBOX Wallet, backup information of CASHBOX Wallet, wallet password backup, mnemonics, private key and Keystore. If you lose your mobile device, delete and fail to backup CASHBOX Wallet information, delete and fail to backup your wallet, have your wallet stolen, or forget wallet password, private key, mnemonics or Keystore, you cannot restore or retrieve your wallet password, private key, mnemonics, or Keystore based on the decentralized features of this service.

7.5 Automatic decision of constrained information system

In some business functions, we may only make decisions based on non-manual automatic decision-making mechanisms including information systems, algorithms, etc. If these decisions significantly affect your legal rights and interests, you have the right to request an explanation from us, and we will also provide a method of appeal without prejudice to CASHBOX Wallet business secrets or other user rights and public interests.

7.6 Respond to your above request

To ensure safety, you may need to provide a written request or otherwise prove your identity. We may ask you to verify your identity before processing your request.

We will reply you within 15 days. You can also make a complaint through the customer service email in case of any dissatisfaction.

We will not be able to respond to your request as required by laws and regulations under the following circumstances:

A. Those related to national security and national defense security;

B. Those related to public safety, public health and major public interests;

C. Those related to criminal investigation, prosecution, trial and execution of judgments;

D. In case there is sufficient evidence that the subject of personal information is subjectively malicious or abuses the rights;

E. In case responding to your request will cause serious damage to the legitimate rights and interests of you or other individuals or organizations;

F. In case it involves trade secrets.

VIII. Information You Share

8.1 You can share your relevant information with others and social networks based on our services, which may contain sensitive information such as your personal identity and property, and you have the freedom to choose the shared objects, which means, the third parties that access to your information.

8.2 When you share your personal information with others, social networks, or third-party service providers, or use third-party service links alone or in conjunction with third-party services, you may disclose or enable third parties to obtain your personal information.

8.3 We recommend that you review the privacy statements of such social networks or third-party service providers to see how they process your information. You shall bear the consequences arising from the provision or sharing of your personal information with others when you use the third-party services, and the corresponding responsible party shall bear the liabilities within the scope prescribed by law.

8.4 When you share any information publicly on the CASHBOX Wallet software, anyone can potentially view or access that information while using the CASHBOX Wallet platform. The information you voluntarily share when using our services may involve the personal information of you or others. Please make choices carefully and bear your own responsibility.


IX. Protection of Minors

9.1 We attach great importance to the protection of personal information of minors. According to relevant laws and regulations, if you are a minor under the age of 18, you should obtain the consent of your parent or legal guardian before using the CASHBOX Wallet services. If you are a minor under the age of 14, your guardian should read the Policy carefully and agree that you apply CASHBOX Wallet software in accordance with the Policy.

9.2 We do not actively collect personal information directly from minors. We will only use, share, transfer or disclose the personal information of minors with the consent of their guardians if permitted by law, agreed by the guardians or necessary to protect the minors.

9.3 If it is proved that a minor has registered to use our products and/or services without the consent of the guardian, we will consult with the relevant guardian and try to delete the relevant personal information as soon as possible. 


X. Scope of Application

The Policy applies to all our services. However, certain services have their own specific privacy guidelines/statements that more specifically describe how we process your information in those services. In the event of any inconsistency between the Policy and the privacy guidelines/statements for a particular service, the specific privacy guidelines/statements shall prevail.

Please note that the Policy does not apply to services provided by other companies or individuals. For example, you can log in to a service provided by another company or individual using the CASHBOX Wallet account.

Your use of such third party services is subject to its privacy policy, not the Policy, and you need to read its policy carefully.

XI. Notification and Revision

11.1 The Privacy Policy will be updated as CASHBOX Wallet develops to provide you with a better service. However, we will not abridge your rights under the Privacy Policy without your express consent. We will upload the updated version on the official website and mobile terminal of CASHBOX Wallet, and remind you of the update of relevant content through a website announcement or other appropriate means before it becomes effective. Besides, we ask you to check out the CASHBOX Wallet APP for the latest privacy policy.

11.2 For significant changes, we will also provide more prominent notifications (we will explain specific changes to the Privacy Policy by including but not limited to emails, text messages or special prompts on browsing pages).

Significant changes referred to in the Privacy Policy include, but are not limited to:

A. Our service model has changed significantly, such as the purpose of processing personal information, the type of personal information processed, and the way to use personal information;

B. We have experienced significant changes in the ownership structure, organizational structure and other aspects, such as business adjustment, bankruptcy merger and acquisition caused by changes of ownership;

C. If there are changes in the main object of personal information sharing, transfer or public disclosure;

D. If your rights to participate in the processing of personal information and mode of execution have changed significantly;

E. When our department responsible for handling personal information security, contact information and complaint channels change;

F. When the assessment report on security impact of personal information indicates a high risk.

11.3 We will also file the old version of the Privacy Policy for your reference.


XII. How to Contact Us

12.1 If you have any questions, comments or suggestions regarding the Privacy Policy or your personal information, please contact the customer service personnel of CASHBOX Wallet.

Email of official customer service: CASHBOX@scry.info
service_agreement:
CASHBOX Wallet App User Service Agreement

The CASHBOX Wallet App is a mobile digital asset security management service platform (hereinafter referred to as the "platform") providing the user with digital asset security management services and related services by the Singapore SCRY INFO PRIVATE LTD. The platform provides services to the user who has registered at the platform (hereinafter referred to as the "user") according to the provisions of this Agreement (as defined below), which is legally binding to both the user and the platform. The platform hereby specially reminds the user to carefully read and fully understand the terms of this Agreement, especially those in this Agreement regarding disclaimer or restriction of liability of the platform, as well as those excluding or restricting the user’s rights. The user shall carefully read the instructions, and select to accept or not to accept this Agreement. Unless all terms under this Agreement are accepted by the user, the user has no right to use the services provided by the platform based on this Agreement. If the user disagrees with the contents of this Agreement or refuses to agree the platform’s rights to unilaterally alter this Agreement at any time, the user shall immediately stop using and no longer visit the platform. Registration as a user or the use of the services provided by the platform indicates that the user has fully understood and accepted all terms of this Agreement (including any modification made by the Company from time to time).

For the convenience of the expression of this Agreement, "we" or other “first person” are used in this Agreement to indicate the platform in this Agreement; the natural person or other subjects visiting the platform is referred to as "user/ you" or other “second person”; we and the user are collectively referred to as "parties", and we or the user are referred to as "either party" in this Agreement.

Chapter I Definitions and interpretations

Article 1 Unless otherwise agreed in the terms of this Agreement, the following words or expressions in this Agreement shall have the following meanings:

(1) This Agreement shall include this service agreement, privacy terms and legal statements, as well as other rules, annexes, statements, instructions or guidelines that have been or will be published on the platform.

(2) Force majeure: including information network equipment maintenance, information network connection failure, computer, communication or other system failures, power failure, unfavorable weathers, accidents, strike, labor disputes, riot, uprising, chaos, insufficient productivity or means of production, fire, flood, storm, explosion, war or other partners’ causes, digital asset market crash, government behaviors, orders issued by judicial or administrative authorities, and other circumstances beyond the control or out of the control of the platform.

(3) Creation or importing of the Wallet: refers to the process of creating or importing the Wallet using the platform after the user’s acceptance of this Agreement.

(4) Affiliated company: a company which has direct or indirect control or significant influence relationship with other companies.

(5) Public key: generated from a private key using one-way derivation method based on the cryptography principle, and used to generate the address of block-chain digital wallet. Digital wallet is the public account collection address.

(6) CASHBOX Wallet (or wallet): a digital asset wallet developed based on the block-chain, including other auxiliary tools developed for the convenience of the user to use the block-chain system.

(7) Wallet password: refers to the password used to encrypt and protect the private key, which shall be decided by the user when creating the wallet. In case of the decentralized application of the CASHBOX Wallet, the wallet password will not be stored in the user's mobile devices or the platform server. Once the user loses or forgets the password, the user requires to use the private key or mnemonics to set up a new wallet password.

(8) Identity: digital identity generated based on the user's public and private keys.

(9) User guideline: refers to the guideline provided by the platform to assist the user in understanding the basic knowledge of block-chain and the basic operation procedures of the platform prior to and/ or after the use of the platform.

(10) Private key: composed of 256 random characters, which is vital for the user to own and use digital assets.

(11) Information message: refers to the information message contents showed in the operation interface of the platform. It is recommended that the user should operate according to the relevant steps.

(12) Message center: the in-box in which the user will receive messages or notifications from the platform.

(13) Intellectual property: refers to the definition of Article 92 of this Agreement.

(14) Mnemonics: in line with the Block-chain Industry Standard BIP39, composed of 12 (or 15/ 18/ 21/ 24) words in order generated by the random algorithm method. It is an easy form to record private key, which is convenient for the user for backup and keeping.

Article 2 Any codes, written decrees or administrative regulations as referred to in this Agreement shall refer to its latest revision, regardless of whether made prior to or after the conclusion of this Agreement.

Article 3 The title of any clause in this Agreement shall be used for the purpose of convenience, and shall not be used for the purpose of its interpretation. Reference to any statement, clauses, annexes or tables shall mean the reference to the statement, clauses, annexes or tables of this Agreement.

Article 4 Unless otherwise required in this Agreement, the word "including" as referred to in this Agreement under any circumstances shall mean "including but not limited to".

Article 5 Unless otherwise agreed in the terms of this Agreement, in case of any conflict or discrepancy between the documents under this Agreement, the effectiveness of the documents shall be determined in the following order to resolve the conflict or discrepancy in question:

(1) CASHBOX Wallet App User Service Agreement;

(2) CASHBOX Wallet App Privacy Terms;

(3) Other agreements, rules and guidelines.

Article 6 The user may select to use different language versions of the platform. In case of discrepancy, conflict or omission among different language versions of the platform, the Chinese version of the platform shall prevail.

Chapter II Basic terms of the platform

Article 7 The platform is a digital asset security management service platform. The platform provides services by the Company to the user through platform and client terminal and other ways. The specific services mainly include digital asset security management services, release of digital asset transaction information, user services and other auxiliary services. Please refer to the specific details of the service contents actually provided by the platform.

Article 8 In order to protect the rights and interests of the user, the user shall carefully read and fully understand all terms of this service agreement prior to the use of platform services voluntarily. The use of platform services shall be deemed as fully understanding and acceptance of this Agreement and any modification made by the platform from time to time; and in case of any legal consequences caused by violations, the user shall independently bear corresponding legal liabilities.

Article 9 The platform may modify this Agreement according to the circumstances during the performance of this Agreement. Upon the changes in the contents of this Agreement, the platform will publish the latest service agreement, and will not give notice to the user individually. If the user disagrees with the modification to this Agreement made by the platform, it has the right to stop using platform services. If the user continues to use platform services, it shall be deemed that the user accepts the modifications to this Agreement made by the platform, and the user shall comply with the modified agreement.

Article 10 For notices, any other agreement, announcements or other notifications regarding the user's use of the services sent to the user by the platform, the user agrees that the platform may sent in the form of platform announcement, internal mail, e-mail, mobile phone short message, wireless communication devices and other electronic or physical means, such as mailing. Such notices shall be deemed to have been served to the recipient when sent out (if sent to the user by mail, the notice shall be deemed to be served three natural days after sent to the contact address left by the user in the platform). If the user fails to receive such notices on the date in which the aforesaid notices are deemed to have been served due to the reasons not attributable to the platform (including inaccurate or invalid email address, mobile phone number, contact address, and information transmission failure, etc.), the platform shall not bear any responsibility.

Article 11 In order to avoid any misoperation of the currency wallet or any security risk of digital token as far as possible, the user shall avoid using the platform without understanding the basic knowledge of block chain. For the user who is not equipped with the basic knowledge of block chain, the Company is entitled to refuse to provide service functions, in whole or in part.

Article 12 The user understands that the Company will suspend the services (or terminate the service completely in case of the following circumstances):

(1) The operation of the platform is interrupted due to technical reasons, such as the maintenances, upgrades and failures of equipment and block-chain system, and communication interruption;

(2) The platform fails to provide services due to force majeure and other factors as it reasonably believes that it will cause a greater risk in continuing to provide such services in doing so;

(3) There is a substantially adverse change in the applicable laws or policies; or

(4) Other circumstances beyond the control of the platform or reasonably foreseen occur.

Article 13 In case of the changes in the platform, or interruption or termination of the services, the user shall have the right to export the wallet information within a reasonable time limit.

Chapter 3 Creation of the wallet

Article 14 Prior to using platform services, the user shall first create the wallet in the platform.

Article 15 The individual user who creates the wallet shall be a natural person who is at least 18 years old or who has full civil rights and capacity for civil conduct according to the laws of the country where the user is located and is able to independently bear civil liabilities.

Article 16 A legal person, organization or other institution that intends to create the wallet shall designate a natural person who acts as the representative of the organization or institution, and is at least 18 years old or has full civil rights and capacity for civil conduct according to the laws of the country where the user is located.

Article 17 This Agreement will pop up when the user creates the wallet for the first time. Clicking the “Consent” button by the user means that the user or the agency legally authorized by the user agrees to all the contents of this Agreement, and the user himself/ herself or the agency authorized by the user is bound by this Agreement. If the user does not have the subject qualification required by Article 15 or Article 16 of this Agreement, the user and the agency which has the right to act as the agent of the user shall bear all the consequences arising therefrom, and the platform shall reserve the right to hold the user and the agency which has the right to act as the agent of the user accountable.

Article 18 Prior to or after the creation of the wallet, the platform shall have the right to refuse to provide services to the user according to the requirements of laws and regulations, rules, orders and other norms of the country or region where the user is located.

Article 19 The user hereby undertakes:

(1) The user shall create the wallet and use the platform’s services for legitimate purposes, and shall not have the intention of violating laws and regulations by using the platform as a medium;

(2) The user shall guarantee that the digital assets stored in the CASHBOX Wallet are from legal sources;

(3) In addition to this Agreement, the user shall abide by all rules issued and updated by the platform from time to time, including announcement, description for use flow, and risk warning, etc.

Article 20 If the user violates the commitments it has made in Article 19 of this Agreement:

(1) The platform shall have the right to stop or refuse the user to use partial or all functions of the services provided by it. In this case, the platform shall not bear any responsibility, and the user agrees to bear any direct or indirect expenses or losses arising therefrom;

(2) The user shall bear any direct or indirect losses and adverse consequences caused by the breach of the commitments, and the platform shall reserve the right to hold the user accountable.

Article 21 The user is willing to use platform services, and the platform does not force, induce, cheat or impose influence on the user by any other unfair means.

Chapter IV Contents of Registering Platform Services

Article 22 The platform shall provide the following services to the user who has completed the registration:

(1) Digital asset security management service;

(2) Information on real-time market conditions and transaction of digital assets;

(3) Digital asset exchange services;

(4) Services provided to the user;

(5) Technical and management services to ensure the normal operation of the platform;

(6) Other services publicized by the platform.

Article 23 The digital asset security management service mentioned in Article 22 of this Agreement shall include the following contents:

(I) Account importing: the digital assets supported by the CASHBOX Wallet. The user may use the CASHBOX Wallet to generate a new wallet, or import a compatible wallet generated by other wallet tools of the system related to the block-chain.

(II) Transfer and payment collection: the user may manage the digital token using the transfer and payment collection functions of the CASHBOX Wallet, i.e., by electronic signature through the private key to modify the account books of the relevant block-chain. Payment transfer refers to the transfer operation by the payer using the recipient's ENS domain name or block-chain address. The "transfer" operation involves the effective records of the transactions in the distributed ledger of the relevant block chain system (rather than the actual delivery or transfer of digital token in the CASHBOX).

(III) Market conditions viewing: the user may use the CASHBOX Wallet to view the exchange rate price of digital token provided by a third party.

(IV) Management of digital token: the user may import, keep or remove other digital asset wallets on the operation interface of the CASHBOX Wallet in addition to the default wallet.

(V) Currency exchange: the user may use the digital asset exchange service provided by the third party. The CASHBOX Wallet is used as the interface tool to assist the user to interact with the third party service provider and to display the corresponding results of digital asset exchange.

(VI) Transaction records: the platform will obtain and display all or partial transaction records of the user from the block-chain, but the user shall refer to the latest transaction records of the block-chain.

(VII) Suspension of services: the platform cannot withdraw or revoke transaction operations for the user due to the "irrevocable" attribute of block-chain transactions. However, in certain circumstances, the platform may suspend or restrict the operations of a certain user on the platform.

Article 24 Upon the receipt of the services specified in Article 22 of this Agreement, the user agrees and understands:

(I) It shall abide by the decentralized characteristics of the block-chain, and the platform will provide decentralized services, which are different from those provided by banking financial institutions, so as to protect the security of the user's digital token. The user understands and accepts that the platform does not assume the following responsibilities:

(1) To store the user's wallet password (i.e., the password set up when the user creates/ imports the wallet), private key, mnemonics or Keystore;

(2) To retrieve the user's wallet password, private key, mnemonics or Keystore;

(3) To freeze the wallet;

(4) To report the loss of the wallet;

(5) To recover the wallet;

(6) To conduct transaction rollback.

(II) The user shall be responsible for taking care of the mobile device containing the currency wallet, backing up CASHBOX Wallet information, wallet password, mnemonics, private key and Keystore. If the mobile device is lost; the CASHBOX Wallet information is deleted or cannot be back up; the wallet is deleted and cannot be back up; the wallet is stolen, or the wallet password, private key, mnemonics or Keystore are forgotten by the user, the platform cannot restore the wallet or retrieve the wallet password, private key, mnemonics or Keystore; and in case of the misoperation in the exchange transaction (such as transferring to the wrong address, and inputting the wrong exchange amount) by the user, the platform neither cancels the transaction, nor bears any responsibility arising therefrom.

(III) The digital token management service provided by the platform does not include the management services of all existing digital assets. It is recommended not to operate any digital assets that are not supported by the platform.

(IV) The currency exchange function provided by the platform is the exchange of digital token in the block-chain system by the user using the third-party smart contract in nature. For the services provided by the third party through smart contract, the platform shall only provide the user with tools to use the third-party smart contract, and shall not provide any guarantee for the functions or service quality of the third-party smart contract. The user shall judge and evaluate whether the services or transactions provided by the third party through smart contract are at risk prior to accepting services or conducting transactions on the third party smart contract. The user shall carefully read and agree to the updated user agreement of relevant smart contracts prior to transactions.

(V) The user understands and agrees to follow the information messages issued by the platform and conducts operations according to the information messages. Otherwise, all risks, responsibilities, losses and expenses arising therefrom shall be borne by the user.

(VI) If the platform reasonably believes that the user's transactions or transaction conditions are abnormal, or the user's identity information is suspicious, or the platform believes that the user shall submit and verify his/ her identity certificates or other necessary documents, the user shall proactively give cooperation to the platform to check the user's effective identity certificates or other necessary documents, and complete the relevant identity verifications in a timely manner. The user understands and accepts that the platform may restrict, suspend or terminate the user's use of the platform until the user provides information that meets the requirements of the platform.

(VII) Account transfer.

(1) The user understands that the daily transfer amount limit and the number of transfers through the platform may be different depending on the country/ region where the user uses the transfer services, as well as regulatory requirements, account transfer purpose, platform risk control, identity authentication and other reasons.

(2) The user understands the "irrevocable" attribute of block-chain operation. When the user uses the transfer function, the user shall bear the consequences caused by the user's misoperation (including but not limited to the problems arising from the user’s entering the wrong transfer address and selecting the transfer node server).

(3) The user acknowledges that during the use of platform services, the following circumstances may result in the unavailability of transfer function, "transaction failure" of account transfers or "packaging timeout":

a) The balance of wallet is insufficient;

b) The transaction gas fee is insufficient;

c) The block-chain fails to execute smart contract code;

d) The payment limit stipulated by the regulatory authorities, the platform, or laws and regulations is exceeded;

e) Network, equipment and other technical faults occur;

f) The transaction is abandoned due to block-chain network congestion, failure and other reasons;

g) The address of the user or that of the counterpart is identified as a special address, such as a high-risk address.

(4) The user acknowledges that the platform only provides transfer tools to the user. The Company has fully fulfilled all obligations of the current services when the user completes the transfer using the platform, and the Company shall not assume any responsibility for other disputes.

(VIII) The user acknowledges that the daily amount limit of currency exchange is currently limited by the third-party smart contract. The platform may also limit the amount of daily currency exchanges by the user from time to time.

(IX) The user acknowledges that when it operates in the platform or conducts transactions through the third-party smart contract of the platform, the user shall comply with the requirements of relevant laws, regulations and national policies.

Article 25 In addition to the services stipulated in Article 22 of this Agreement and the technical services publicized by the platform, the platform does not provide the user with any professional opinions on digital asset transactions, such as investments, laws and taxes. Any messages, discussion, analysis, price and other information provided by the platform are general comments, which shall not constitute any suggestions on the digital asset transactions for the user. If the user requires professional advice, he/ she shall consult the relevant professionals with professional advice on investments, laws, taxes related to the digital currency transactions. The platform shall not be liable for any direct or indirect losses (including any losses in profits) caused by the user's reliance on the above general comments.

Article 26 The services provided by the platform shall not be deemed to be used or used as an offer to the user in any country or region where the platform believes that it is illegal to provide services to such country or region.

Article 27 The platform shall have the right to modify, suspend or permanently stop partial or all services provided by the platform open to the user for the following reasons:

(I) The user is in violation of the laws and regulations, rules, orders and other specifications of the user's country or region;

(II) The platform protects its legitimate interests or those of its users;

(III) Other reasonable reasons.

Article 28 If the platform modifies, suspends or permanently stops partial or all services provided by the platform open to the user as stipulated in Article 27 of this Agreement, the effective date shall be subject to the announcement published by the platform.

Chapter V Account security and management

Article 29 The user understands and agrees that it is the user's responsibility to set up the password and to keep the confidentiality and security of the password. The user shall assume full responsibility for all actions and remarks made by using his/ her account and password, and agree to the following matters:

(I) The user shall create passwords according to the relevant rules and the relevant messages of the platform, and avoid using too easy words or dates, such as the user's name, nickname or birthday, etc.;

(II) When creating a password, the user shall meet the four requirements as stipulated in the platform. When meeting a certain requirement, a message will appear on the screen, and only when all four requirements are met will the password be successfully entered;

(III) After the password is entered, the user is required to enter the password for a second time for verification. If the password entered is inconsistent for the two times, the platform will pop up a warning message;

(IV) Only when the password entered is consistent for the two times, the platform will pop up a message indicating that the password is created successfully;

(V) The user shall not disclose his/ her password or use the password of any other person. If the user's account is illegally used by others not due to the platform’s reasons, such as hacking, viruses, or user's negligence, the platform shall not bear any responsibility;

(VI) The user shall not donate, lend, rent, transfer or otherwise dispose of the wallet created by himself/ herself to a third party without the consent of the platform;

(VII) The user confirms that all behaviors after importing password to the platform represent the user himself/ herself. The electronic information records generated by the user's operation are all considered as the valid credentials of the user's behaviors, and the user himself/ herself shall bear all the responsibilities arising therefrom;

(VIII) After the platform informs the user of the security risks that may be foreseen, the user shall take measures to ensure the security of the password;

(IX) In case of the stealing of others' passwords without permission, the platform and its legal authorized subject shall reserve the right to hold the actual user responsible for joint and several liabilities.

Article 30 If the user finds that a third party uses or steals his/ her password, or under any other circumstances without legal authorization, he/ she shall immediately notify the platform in an effective way and to request the platform to suspend the relevant services, otherwise all the responsibilities arising therefrom shall be borne by the user himself/ herself. In addition, the user understands that the platform needs a reasonable period to take action on the user's request. Before that, the platform shall not bear any responsibility for the losses caused by the third party's use of the services.

Article 31 The user shall take full responsibility of taking good care of the mobile device, wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore and other information. The Company shall not be responsible for taking care of the above information for the user. All risks, responsibilities, losses and expenses caused by the user's loss of mobile device, active or passive disclosure, or forgetting of wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore, or attack or defraud by others shall be borne by the user himself/ herself.

Article 32 The platform shall, based on its independent judgment that the transaction safety may be endangered, have the right to suspend, interrupt or terminate the supply of all or partial services (including charging services) under this Agreement to the user without notification, and shall not bear any responsibility to the user or any third party. The above circumstances are as follows:

(I) The user dies;

(II) The platform discovers the digital assets of the wallet suspicious or in danger of violating the laws;

(III) The platform considers that the user is suspected of money laundering, cashing, pyramid selling, being used fraudulently, or other circumstances that the platform considers risky;

(IV) The user steals other people's wallet information or mobile devices;

(V) The user provides false information to the platform;

(VI) The user refuses the mandatory update operation of the platform;

(VII) The user spreads rumors and damages the goodwill of the platform;

(VIII) The platform finds the user to harm the safety of digital asset management using illegal or improper technical means;

(IX) The platform believes that the user has violated various rules and principles stipulated in this Agreement;

(X) The wallet created by the user has not been logged in for one consecutive year or the actual digital asset is zero;

(XI) Other circumstances in which the user violates this Agreement.

Article 33 The user agrees that if the user’s account has not completed identity authentication and has not logged in for one consecutive year, the platform shall have the right to terminate the supply of account services to the user without prior notice, and may immediately suspend, close or delete the user account and all relevant data and files stored in the user’s account.

Article 34 The user agrees that the suspension, interruption or termination of the user's account does not represent the termination of the user's liability. The user shall still be liable for breach of contract or damages for his/ her behaviors during the service period when she/ she uses the platform, and the platform still retains the user's relevant information.

Chapter VI Guarantees and commitments of the user

Article 35 The user undertakes not to use platform services for any illegal purpose or in any illegal way, and to abide by the relevant laws and regulations of the country where the user is located and all international practices of using the Internet, and to comply with all network protocols, rules and procedures related to platform services.

Article 36 The user agrees and warrants that he/ she shall not use platform services to infringe upon the rights and interests of others or violate the laws, or shall bear all legal liabilities in case of any violation. The above violations are as follows:

(I) The user uses platform services in the name of others;

(II) The user engages in any illegal transactions, such as trafficking in guns, drugs, banned drugs, pirated software or other prohibited goods;

(III) The user provides gambling information or induces others to participate in gambling in any way;

(IV) The user is suspected of money laundering, cashing or pyramid selling;

(V) The user is engaged in any possible uses or disseminations of computer viruses or possible infringement upon platform service systems and data, etc.;

(VI) The user uses the platform service system for behaviors that may cause adverse effects on the normal operation of the Internet or mobile network;

(VII) The user maliciously interferes with the normal process of digital asset transactions and the order of digital asset transactions;

(VIII) The user interferes with the normal operations of the platform or other users’ use of platform services by any technical or other means;

(IX) The user maliciously slanders the goodwill of the platform in the way of fabrication and exaggeration, etc.;

(X) Other behaviors that the platform considers inappropriate based on justifiable reasons occur.

Article 37 The platform shall, according to its own judgment, reserve the right to delete various illegal, unauthentic or inappropriate information in the platform without notification to the user, and shall not bear any responsibility. If the user fails to comply with the above provisions, the platform shall have the right to make independent judgment and take measures, such as suspending or closing the user account, and shall not bear any responsibility.

Article 38 The user agrees that if he/ she breaches this Agreement, or violates the documents which are incorporated into this Agreement by reference and therefore constitute a part of this Agreement, or is in violation of any laws or the rights of a third party due to the use of platform services, resulting in any claim or request for compensation (including attorney's fees) made or initiated by any third party, the user shall make a full compensation and keep the platform, and its affiliates, partners, directors and employee harmless.

Article 39 The user undertakes that the information uploaded or released by him / her to the platform is authentic and effective, and any information submitted by him/ her to the platform is authentic, effective, complete, detailed and accurate. If any loss is caused to the platform or other users due to the breaches of the above commitments, the user shall bear the corresponding responsibility.

Article 40 The user understands and agrees that the platform provides services to qualified users. The platform shall not bear any responsibility for the digital asset investments or transactions conducted on the platform, and the platform cannot and shall not have any obligation to ensure the success of the user's investments. The user shall bear the losses caused by investments or transactions of the digital assets, and the platform shall not bear any responsibilities arising therefrom.

Article 41 The user agrees to be responsible for all activities (including information disclosure, information release, clicking to agree to various agreements, uploading and submission of various documents, clicking to agree to renew various agreements or clicking to agree to digital currency transactions, etc.) conducted using the registered account of the platform, and if the user fails to comply with the terms of this Agreement or the operation instruction rules for transactions published by the platform during the above activities, the platform shall not bear any responsibility.

Article 42 The user agrees that the platform has the right to launch various commercial advertisements or other commercial information of any type (including advertising on any page of the platform) during the supply of platform services, and the user agrees to accept commercial promotions or other relevant commercial information sent by the platform to the user through email or other means.

Article 43 The user agrees that if the user has disputes with the project party or other third parties due to the digital asset transactions, he/ she shall not require the platform to provide relevant information through any approaches other than judicial or administrative approaches.

Chapter 7 Interruptions of services or failures

Article 44 The user agrees that, based on the particular characteristics of the Internet, the platform shall not guarantee the services will not be interrupted, nor the timeliness and/ or security of the services. If the system fails to operate normally due to relevant conditions, resulting in the user unable to use any platform services or to suffer any impact when using any platform services, the platform shall not be responsible for the user or the third parties. The above circumstances are as follows:

(I) The period during which the platform system is shut down for maintenance.

(II) The telecommunication equipment has failure and therefore fails to transmit data.

(III) Platform services are interrupted or delayed due to hacker attack, technical adjustment or failure of network supplier, website upgrade and other reasons.

(IV) The platform system has failure and therefore cannot perform businesses due to typhoon, earthquake, tsunami, flood, power failure, war, terrorist attack and other force majeure.

Chapter VIII Scope and limitation of liability

Article 45 The platform does not provide any form of guarantee for any platform services, including the following matters:

(I) Platform services will meet the needs of the user.

(II) Platform services will be uninterrupted, provided on time or free of errors.

(III) Any product, service, information or other materials purchased or obtained by the user through platform services will meet the user's expectation.

(IV) All information, programs, text and data contained in the platform are completely safe and free from the interference and destruction of any viruses, Trojans and other malicious programs.

(V) The calculations of all transaction results have been verified by the platform, and the corresponding calculation methods will be publicized on the platform, but the platform cannot guarantee that the calculations are free of errors or interference.

Article 46 The user understands and agrees that in any case, the platform will not be liable for any of the following events:

(I) Losses in revenue of the user;

(II) Losses in trading profit or contract of the user;

(III) Losses caused by the interruption, suspension or termination of services;

(IV) Losses expected to save transaction costs;

(V) The losses caused by the problem in information transmission;

(VI) Losses of investments or trading opportunities;

(VII) Losses of goodwill or reputation;

(VIII) Losses caused by the missing or damage of data;

(IX) Costs of purchasing alternative products or services;

(X) Any indirect, special or incidental losses caused by infringement (including intentional and negligent infringements), breach of contract, or any other reasons, regardless of reasonably foreseeable by the platform, and whether or not the platform is informed of the possibility of such losses in advance;

(XI) Loss of the user's digital token due to the missing of mobile device, deletion and failure to back up CASHBOX Wallet information, and forgetting and failure to back up wallet password, private key, mnemonics and Keystore;

(XII) Loss of digital token by the user due to his/ her disclosure of wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore, or borrowing, transferring or authorizing others to use their own mobile device or CASHBOX Wallet, or failure to download platform application through the official channel of the Company or to use platform application in other unsafe ways;

(XIII) The loss of digital token caused by the user's wrong operations (including but not limited to the user's input of wrong transfer address and the problem in the user's own selection of transfer node server);

(XIV) The loss of digital token due to misoperation because the user does not understand the knowledge of block chain technology;

(XV) The deviations in transaction records, resulting in the copying of the user by the platform on the block-chain due to system delay, block chain instability and other reasons.

Article 47 The user understands and agrees that in case of any of the following circumstances, the platform shall have the right to refuse to make compensation for the user's losses, in whole or in part:

(I) The platform has reasonable reasons to believe that the user's behaviors on the platform are suspected to be illegal or unethical.

(II) The user mistakenly believes that the loss is caused by the platform;

(III) Any other losses not caused by the platform.

Article 48 The quality and contents of the services provided by the company cooperating with the platform in providing services shall be the sole responsibility of the company cooperating with the platform. The contents of the platform may involve other websites owned, controlled or operated by any third party (hereinafter referred to as "third party websites"). The platform cannot and shall not have the obligation to guarantee the authenticity and validity of any information contained in the third party websites. The user confirms to use the third party websites according to the service agreement of the third party websites, rather according to this Agreement. The contents, products, advertisements and any other information of the third party websites shall be judged by the user, and the user shall bear the risks, which are irrelevant with the platform. Any data downloaded or obtained by the user through the use of platform services shall be judged by the user and the risks shall be borne by himself/ herself, and any damages caused by the downloading of the data shall be borne by the user.

Article 49 Suggestions or information obtained by the user from the platform and the platform’s staff or through platform services, whether written or oral, shall not constitute any guarantee by the platform.

Article 50 The platform shall not guarantee the accuracy, validity, security and integrity of the external links set up to provide convenience for the user. In addition, the platform does not assume any responsibility for the contents of any web pages that such external links connecting to and that are not actually controlled by the platform.

Article 51 To the extent permitted by law, the platform shall not be liable for any indirect, punitive, special and derivative damages caused by the platform in connection with or arising from this Agreement, or by the use of the platform, or by the use of all information, contents, materials, products (including software) and services contained in or otherwise provided to the user through the platform, or the purchase and use of products (including losses in business, revenues, profits, use of data or other economic benefits), regardless of the reason or whether caused by the breach of this Agreement (including breach of warranty) or infringement, even if it has been informed of the possibility of such loss in advance. In addition, even if the exclusive remedy stipulated in this Agreement fails to achieve its basic purpose, the platform's liability for the above losses shall be excluded.

Article 52 Unless otherwise specified in this Agreement, in any case, the total amount of the platform's liability for the breach of this Agreement shall not exceed the market value of 0.1 ETH.

Article 53 Unless otherwise specified in this Agreement, in any case, if the platform suffers losses due to the user's violation of this Agreement or the laws and regulations of the country where the user is located, the user shall make compensation to the platform for all direct and/ or indirect losses (including litigation costs, etc.).

Article 54 Both the platform and the user acknowledge that the remedies of the common law may not be sufficient to cover the losses, in whole or in part, suffered by non-breaching party for breach or possible breach of contract, so both parties agree that either party shall have the right to seek injunctive relief and all other remedies permitted by common law or law of equity in case of breach or possible breach of contract by the other party.

Article 55 The warranties and commitments made by the platform under this Agreement are the only warranties and representations (hereinafter referred to as the "agreement warranties") made by the platform regarding the services provided by it according to this Agreement, and replace the warranties and commitments (hereinafter referred to as the "non-agreement warranties") made by any other means and methods, whether in written or oral form, expressed or implied. All the agreement guarantees are only made by the platform, which are binding on the platform, but not binding on any third party.

Article 56 The user understands and agrees that the platform does not waive any right not mentioned in this Agreement, nor exempt or set off its liability for claiming damages to the maximum extent applicable by laws.

Chapter IX Risk warning

Article 57 The transactions of digital assets are of high risks and are not suitable for most people for investment. The user acknowledges and understands that the investment may lead to partial or total losses, so the user shall determine the amount of his/ her investment or transaction based on the degree of loss he/ she can tolerate. The user shall carefully assess his/ her financial situation and various risks prior to making any decision on digital asset investments or transactions. The user shall bear all the losses caused by the decision, and the platform shall not bear any responsibility for the user's decisions on investment or transaction.

Article 58 The platform shall not provide any guarantees or raise any conditions for any user and/ or any transaction, whether expressed, implied or statutory. The platform cannot and will not attempt to control the information released by the user or project parties. For such information, the platform does not provide services in any form, such as certification and authentication. The platform does not fully guarantee the authenticity, sufficiency, reliability, accuracy, integrity and effectiveness of the contents published in the platform, and is not required to bear any legal liability arising therefrom. The user shall rely on his/ her independent judgment to conduct the transaction, and take full responsibility for the judgment made by himself/ herself.

Article 59 In view of the risks arising from the investment of digital assets or exchange, if the user has any questions about such investment or transaction, he/ she shall seek the assistance of a professional consultant prior to the transaction or investment.

Article 60 The platform shall not make any expressed or implied guarantee for the user’s use of platform services, including but not limited to the suitability, fee-of-error or omission, sustainability, accuracy, reliability and applicability to a specific purpose of the services provided by the platform. In addition, we do not make any commitment and guarantee for the validity, accuracy, correctness, reliability, quality, stability, integrity and timeliness of the technology and information of the services provided by the platform.

Article 61 Whether to log on or to use the services provided by the platform is the user's personal decision, and the user shall bear the risks and potential losses. The platform shall not make any expressed or implied guarantee for the marketability, value and price of digital assets. The user acknowledges and understands that the digital asset market is not stable, and the price and value of digital assets will fluctuate significantly or collapse at any time. The transaction of digital assets is the free choice and decision of the user himself/ herself, who shall bear the risks and possible losses arising therefrom.

Article 62 The above provisions do not cover all the risks and market conditions of the transactions conducted by the user through the platform. Prior to making a transaction decision, the user shall fully understand the relevant digital assets, make prudent decisions according to his/ her own transaction objectives, risk tolerance ability and asset situations, and bear all risks on his/ her own.

Article 63 The market view function provided by the platform is only to collect the search results of digital token exchange rate information from some exchange houses, and does not represent the latest market condition or the best quotation.

Article 64 If the user or his/ her counterpart fails to comply with the operation procedures and rules stipulated in this Agreement or the related website instructions, transactions and payment pages when using platform services, the platform shall not guarantee the smooth completion of the transaction, nor assumes the liability for damages. In case of the above circumstances, if the payment has been recorded into the CASHBOX Wallet or the third-party wallet of the user or his/ her counterpart, the user understands the "irreversibility" attribute of block-chain operation and the "irrevocability" feature of related transactions, so the user and his/ her counterpart shall bear the corresponding risk consequences.

Article 65 The user understands and acknowledges that the currency exchange transaction shall be conducted, proceeded and completed based on the third-party smart contract. The platform only serves as an interface tool to assist the user and the third-party smart contract to interact with and to display the corresponding results of the transactions completed.

Article 66 In the use of the platform’s integrated third-party smart contract services, the user shall carefully read the user agreement, privacy policy and other relevant documents and information of the third-party smart contract, understand the trading partner and product information, and conduct transactions on the third-party smart contract after carefully assessment of the risks. The user understands that the transaction and the binding contractual relationship are established between the user and the user's counterpart, which are independent of the platform. Therefore, the platform shall not bear any responsibility for all risks, responsibilities, losses and expenses caused by the user's transactions.

Article 67 In case of "transaction failure", "packaging timeout" and other similar abnormal information messages during account transfer, the user shall reconfirm through the relevant official approaches or other query tools of block-chain, so as to avoid repeated account transfers; otherwise, all losses and expenses caused thereby shall be borne by the user.

Article 68 The user understands that the user's Keystore, private key, mnemonics and other information are only stored in the current mobile device, instead of the platform or the server of the platform after he/ she has created or imported the wallet to the platform. The user may change the mobile device by synchronous wallet and other methods according to the operation guideline provided by the platform. However, if the user does not save or back up the wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore and other information, and if the user's mobile device is lost, resulting in the loss of his/ her digital token, the Company cannot retrieve it for the user. If the user discloses wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore and other information during exporting, save-up or backup, or the device or server storing or backing up the above information is attacked or controlled by hackers, the user's digital token will be lost, the Company cannot retrieve it for the user. Any and all losses caused by the above circumstances shall be borne by the user.

Article 69 The user shall make a safe backup of the wallet password, private key, mnemonics, Keystore and other information of the wallet when creating or importing the wallet. The user is forbidden to use the following electronic backup methods: screenshots, e-mails, mobile phone notepad applications, SMS, We-Chat, QQ and other electronic backup methods. The user shall write mnemonics, Keystore and other information on paper notebooks.

Article 70 The user shall use the platform in a safe network environment, to ensure that his/ her mobile device is not jailbroken or root, so as to avoid potential security risks.

Article 71 Under any circumstance, the third party shall be responsible for the user’s use of related services provided by the third party during the period of using platform services, and the platform shall not bear such responsibilities.

Article 72 Any loss or liability caused by the user's own reasons shall be borne by the user himself/ herself, and the platform shall not assume responsibility. The circumstances in which the platform does not assume responsibility are as follows:

(I) Any loss or liability caused by the user's failure to operate according to this Agreement or any rules published by the platform from time to time;

(II) Any loss or liability caused by unclear, ambiguous or incomplete instruction information sent by the user to the platform;

(III) Any loss or liability caused by insufficient balance of digital assets in the user’s account;

(IV) Any other losses or liabilities caused by the user.

Chapter X Service fees and other expenses

Article 73 The platform charges the user for relevant platform services when the user uses platform services. For the service fees of each platform, please refer to the charging instructions and standards listed in the platform when the user uses platform services. The platform shall reserve the right to unilaterally formulate and adjust the charging standards for platform service fees.

Article 74 In case of the use of the currency exchange services by the user, the exchange service provider will charge services fees and/ or service fees from the user. The specific fees shall be subject to the amount charged by the partners, and the platform information is for reference only.

Article 75 "Gas fees" or network fees shall be paid when the user uses the platform for account transfer, and the amount shall be determined by the user and charged by the relevant block-chain network. The user acknowledges that under certain circumstances (including but not limited to insufficient "gas fees" or network fees paid by the user for account transfer during the period of transfer, or the instability of the relevant block-chain network), the user's transfer operation may fail.
